content: aeonium -hot pad and potholder- design by lusianne this pattern is designed for a 4 5mm between g and h hook and istex létt-lopi yarn but it can easily be adapted to any yarn and any hook size just be sure that it s a 100% wool tread with no superwash treatment so it can be felt aeonium is made of two layers of 7 double_crochet rounds -that can be identical or different- joined together by a 8th round of single_crochet sts you can use the amount of colors you want and make it unique pattern copyright © lusianne the pattern is for unlimited personal and non commercial use do not reproduce or sell the pattern or sell items that are knitted from this pattern abbreviations used double_crochet double_crochet chain chain single_crochet single_crochet st stitch half_double_crochet half_double_crochet ● recto chain 4 and join to form a ring round 1 chain 3 make 1dc in the ring chain 1 *2 double_crochet in the ring chain 1* repeat from *to* 4 more time slip_stitch into 3rd chain of initial chain-3 to join the round you ve got 6 clusters of 2dc break yarn for changing color round 2 insert your hook between 2 2dc-clusters chain 3 make 1dc in the space between clusters chain 1 2 double_crochet in the same space ch1 *2 double_crochet in the next space ch1 2 double_crochet in the same space chain 1* repeat from *to* 4 more time slip_stitch into 3rd chain of initial chain-3 to join the round you ve got 12 clusters of 2dc round 3 insert your hook between 2 2dc-clusters chain 3 make 2dc in the space between clusters chain 1 *3 double_crochet in the next space ch1* repeat from *to* 10 more time slip_stitch into 3rd chain of initial chain-3 to join the round you ve got 12 clusters of 3dc round 4 insert your hook between 2 3dc-clusters chain 3 make 2dc in the space between clusters chain 1 *3 double_crochet in the next space ch1* repeat from *to* 10 more time slip_stitch into 3rd chain of initial chain-3 to join the round you ve got 12 clusters of 3dc pattern copyright © lusianne the pattern is for unlimited personal and non commercial use do not reproduce or sell the pattern or sell items that are knitted from this pattern round 5 insert your hook between 2 3dc-clusters chain 3 make 2dc in the space between clusters chain 1 3 double_crochet in the same space ch1 *3 double_crochet in the next space ch1 3dc in the same space chain 1* repeat from *to*10 more time slip_stitch into 3rd chain of initial chain-3 to join the round you ve got 24 clusters of 3dc round 6 insert your hook between 2 3dc-clusters chain 3 make 2dc in the space between clusters chain 1 *3 double_crochet in the next space ch1* repeat from *to* 22 more time slip_stitch into 3rd chain of initial chain-3 to join the round you ve got 24 clusters
